title: How to Enter Recovery Mode on Android Smartphones

steps.title: Press and hold the Power button and select Power Off.
steps.content: Press and hold the Power button and select Power Off . You'll want to start with your Android powered down so you can get into recovery mode. If the touchscreen is unresponsive, you can hold the power key until the device shuts down.

steps.title: For most phones, you'll press and hold the Power and Volume Down buttons together.
steps.content: For most phones, you'll press and hold the Power and Volume Down buttons together. But every phone is different. Other common button combinations are: [1] X Research source Volume Up, Volume Down, and Power Volume Up, Home, and Power Volume Down, Home, and Power

steps.title: After a few moments, you'll see a logo of an Android on its back.
steps.content: After a few moments, you'll see a logo of an Android on its back. Typically, it's the same logo you see when installing a system update.

steps.title: You'll use the volume and power keys to navigate and make selections.
steps.content: You'll use the volume and power keys to navigate and make selections. Use the Volume Up and Volume Down buttons to move up and down, and press the Power button to select an item. Some devices have a menu that precedes Recovery Mode. In such an instance, use the Volume buttons to select "Recovery Mode" and press the Power button.
